node.title: Flood-hit Canadian province limits petrol purchases, non-essential travel
node.alt: A "No Exit" sign is seen along the side of a flooded dead-end road
node.description: British Columbia imposes restrictions on fuel and non-essential travel to ease supply chain disruptions and support recovery work after floods and mudslides that have destroyed roads, houses and left thousands stranded.
node.content:
["British Columbia has imposed temporary restrictions on fuel and non-essential travel to ease supply chain disruptions and support recovery work following floods and mudslides that have destroyed roads, houses and left thousands stranded in the western Canadian province.", "The orders, announced by Deputy Premier Mike Farnworth in a briefing, limits people in some areas, including\u00a0Vancouver Island, to 30 litres of fuel per visit to a petrol station until December\u00a01.", "Non-essential travel along severely affected highways will also be prohibited.", "\"These orders will help keep commercial traffic moving, stabilise our supply chains and make sure everyone gets home safely,\" Mr Farnworth said.", "The storms, which started last weekend, forced the closure of the Trans Mountain Pipeline and cut two critical east-west rail lines owned by Canadian Pacific\u00a0Railway and Canadian National Railway\u00a0that lead to Canada's busiest port of Vancouver, impeding the supply of fuel and goods.", "", "
Officials have described the floods as \"catastrophic\".(AP: Darryl Dyck/The Canadian Press)
", "Mr Farnworth said the province was also working with the federal government to import fuel via alternate ways including by truck and barge from the United States or the neighbouring province of Alberta.", "Hours before the restrictions were announced, the flood-battered province received some good news when Canadian Pacific\u00a0said work to repair damaged infrastructure would continue non-stop and service should be restored in the middle of next week.", "\"Barring any unforeseen issues, we currently estimate service will be restored mid-week,\" spokesperson Salem Woodrow said in an email.", "The Trans Mountain Pipeline, which carries up to 300,000 barrels per day of crude oil from Alberta province to the Pacific coast, said it was \"optimistic\" that it could restart the pipeline in some capacity by the end of next week.", "", "
Railway operators are rushing to repair infrastructure.(AP: Darryl Dyck/The Canadian Press)
", "Canadian National\u00a0said it was making progress in repairing its impacted rail network in British Columbia, but it expected\u00a0the repair work to continue at least into next week.", "The disaster looks set to be the costliest natural disaster\u00a0to ever hit Canada.", "The railway shutdowns have left exporters of commodities scrambling to divert shipments away from Vancouver and underscored the vulnerability of Canada's supply chains to climate change.", "", "
Canadian officials are trying to re-establish vital supply chains.(AP: Jonathan Hayward/The Canadian Press)
", "Water pumps are still working flat out in the city of Abbotsford to the east of Vancouver.", "If they fail, officials say all 160,000 residents may have to leave.", "Bruce Banman, a provincial politician who represents the area, surveyed the damage from a helicopter and said about 50 per cent\u00a0of agriculture-rich Sumas prairie remained\u00a0underwater.", "", "
The disaster has highlighted Canadian supply chains' vulnerability to climate change.(AP: Jonathan Hayward/The Canadian Press)
", "\"It's heartbreaking to see. There are farmers still trying to save livestock.\"", "He said infrastructure repairs alone would cost more than $C1 billion ($1.1 billion) and that did not cover the loss of crops.", "Reuters"]
